ygData.subject: Re: My thoughts
ygData.msgSnippet: ... No the quest always worked, the problem was that no one had used all the proper spells on the Ogre to raise the faction high enough.  That is why an
ygData.messageBody:
mstokes wrote:

> From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
>
> Minor Correction here. The Glowing Stien was NOT part of the game until less than
> 1 week before the spoiler went up. It was the reward for the Brewers Compendium
> Quest. The quest, until recently, was broken. It returned Pungala's head (Ogre
> Head), not the compendium. Many bartender's have tried this quest, and it was a
> bartender who first completed it. On a side note, GM's informed several players
> that the quest indeed worked, before the patch. They then came back and said it
> will be fixed in an up coming patch (Another Lie)

No the quest always worked, the problem was that no one had used all the proper spells
on the Ogre to raise the faction high enough. That is why an enchanter was required
to do the quest, which was the part that the general population of norrath didn't
figure out until a week before the last patch.

--Eron
aeron@...
-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

from The Simpsons:

Bart: Is there a Doggie Hell??
Homer: Well.... Of course! There couldn't be a heaven if there weren't a hell.
Bart: Who's in there??
Homer: Oh, uh...Hitler's dog. And that dog Nixon had, whassisname, um, Chester...
Lisa: Checkers.
Homer: Yeah! One of the Lassies is in there too. The mean one---the one that mauled
Timmy!
